intro: Stenanthium gramineum, commonly known as the grassy false hellebore, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to eastern North America. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its tall, grass-like foliage and clusters of small, white or pale green flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and thrives in rich, well-drained soils. Its rhizomatous root system allows it to spread and form dense colonies. Stenanthium gramineum is noted for its ornamental value and ecological importance, providing habitat and nectar for various pollinators.
